channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I have early Alzheimer’s and my husband has stage 4 kidney disease. We just inherited $50K. How can this help us?
item.description: “We have a 401(k) with $20,000, and $29,000 in a Roth IRA.”

item.title: Enphase Energy just cast more doubt about its immediate future
item.description: Investors fret about Enphase’s estimates of lower sales in the current quarter.

item.title: ‘I have a degree in economics’: I’m 70, earn $250K a year and have $3.7 million in investments. Is it time to retire?
item.description: “I have a home worth $1.3 million with $900,000 in equity. I have not paid it off as I have a 3% interest rate.”

item.title: Philip Morris says black-market cigarettes are a big deal, as sales miss and stock falls
item.description: Shares of Philip Morris, parent of Marlboro cigarettes and Zyn nicotine pouches, dropped after a rare revenue miss, as a growing illicit market for ci...

item.title: Why is Texas Instruments’ stock sliding after earnings? Analysts boil it down to one word.
item.description: Analysts say the tone on the earnings call was “moody” and “appears to have shifted markedly” as executives express more caution.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
